body:
Unsourced my arse, the etymology is correct. Byzantine Greek attests "Sklábos" /ˈskla.vos/ for Slav, and even the epenthetic /k/ is expected (Greek phonotactics avoid initial /sl/ clusters). 

At this rate they're grasping at straws.

post.title: This post was deleted few hours ago

body:
That's not true (from what I understand).

Slavic people were enslaved in Western Europe, Africa, and Arabian countries throughout the middle ages, and I can't really find how many were enslaved.

North Africa enslaved about 1.2 million Europeans in the Barbary slave trade until the 18th century.

America enslaved about 10 million Africans in the Atlantic slave trade until the 18th century.

Arabia enslaved about 15 million Africans until the 19th century.

Slavery has been a way of life for the entire world until recently.

If I'm missing something let me know, but while westerners definitely have tunnel vision when it comes to this stuff, Africa was hardest hit by slavery from 1600 - 1800. What people don't seem to understand is that Western Europe ended slavery with the Abolitionist movement, which had reverberations around the world with Arabian countries following close behind in the 19th century, and China following in the early 20th century. Slavery still exists in some forms in Africa and Asia.

Slavery still exists in some forms in Africa and Asia.

body:
The reason why we see the enslavement of the Africans as worse as all the others is, because of the way we saw ourselves compared to them.

The Slavic and European held by the Muslims and Western Europeans were seen as having equal worth as human beings and were treated with some dignity. 
African Slaves were seen as subhuman beasts that had to be tamed, so all of the violence against them was seen as justified and morally good and white people saw themselves as vastly superior to them, a mindset that remains with a lot of whites up to this day.

post.title: This post was deleted few hours ago

body:
Can't really argue, Africans were treated worse overall.

That said, Europeans were treated exactly the same way in the Barbary trade as Africans were treated in the Atlantic trade. Also, the Muslims treated Africans much worse (akin to concentration camps).

But what is this, the pain olympics?

My problem is that activists have an obsession with victimhood:
 
**The obsession is myopic.**

In the days of Nazi Germany, the Slavs were also seen as sub-human, and over 5 million were exterminated in concentration camps. Do you see anyone giving a shit? Even the Slavs don't care (I am one), because it's ancient history. People in America think that only Jews and, for some reason, black people were persecuted and exterminated.

Black people talking about "Nazis" and their racism towards them is insulting, considering the real Nazis didn't have much of a problem with them: "While Black people in Nazi Germany were never subject to mass extermination as in the cases of Jews, Romani and Slavs,[1] they were still considered by the Nazis to be an inferior race and, along with Romani people, were subject to the Nuremberg Laws under a supplementary decree."

Currently, in Libya: "Slaves are often ransomed to their families and in the meantime until ransom can be paid tortured, forced to work, sometimes to death and eventually executed or left to starve if they can't pay for too long. Women are often raped and used as sex slaves and sold to brothels and private Libyan clients." Does anyone give a shit? Nope.

10 countries in Africa **still** have slavery. Does anyone care? No.

Do I even need to get into the past and current atrocities of Asia?

They proclaim white people to be the top racists and brutalizers, when that couldn't be further from the truth.

**They themselves are not the victims.**

My **immediate** family was put into concentration camps by the Germans, and gulags by the Russians. On my grandfather's side, it seems everyone died except him and his uncle. Do I go around proclaiming my victim-hood? No, because it wasn't me who suffered, I understand that things are different now, and I understand human nature well enough not to blame current Germans and Russians for what happened. My grandparents didn't hate them either.

**They deny others' lived realities.**

I have just as much right, as a "white cis hetero" person, to go around blaming everyone for my problems as they do. I'd only be blocked out because progressivism hasn't yet reached the education level where they'd realize there are a lot more "victims" out there than they think.
 
**The West is the only culture to ever shed barbaric treatment of the "other" and begin to welcome all as equals. The West is the world's pioneer in social justice.**

They mischaracterize the West as this extremely racist culture, where everyone seems to just hate black people. There is racism, for sure, but the West is the only place where the experiment of true multi-culturalism is embraced. We need reform, not demonization, and not constant bitching about the past. The racists have a point when they say "if you don't like it, leave" - that is very much true about this experiment, it's optional and we're all part of it. If people don't like the culture, they can freely leave to better pastures.

That said, Europeans were treated exactly the same way in the Barbary trade as Africans were treated in the Atlantic trade. Also, the Muslims treated Africans much worse (akin to concentration camps).

But what is this, the pain olympics?

My problem is that activists have an obsession with victimhood:

The obsession is myopic.

In the days of Nazi Germany, the Slavs were also seen as sub-human, and over 5 million were exterminated in concentration camps. Do you see anyone giving a shit? Even the Slavs don't care (I am one), because it's ancient history. People in America think that only Jews and, for some reason, black people were persecuted and exterminated.

Black people talking about "Nazis" and their racism towards them is insulting, considering the real Nazis didn't have much of a problem with them: "While Black people in Nazi Germany were never subject to mass extermination as in the cases of Jews, Romani and Slavs,[1] they were still considered by the Nazis to be an inferior race and, along with Romani people, were subject to the Nuremberg Laws under a supplementary decree."

Currently, in Libya: "Slaves are often ransomed to their families and in the meantime until ransom can be paid tortured, forced to work, sometimes to death and eventually executed or left to starve if they can't pay for too long. Women are often raped and used as sex slaves and sold to brothels and private Libyan clients." Does anyone give a shit? Nope.

10 countries in Africa still have slavery. Does anyone care? No.

Do I even need to get into the past and current atrocities of Asia?

They proclaim white people to be the top racists and brutalizers, when that couldn't be further from the truth.

They themselves are not the victims.

My immediate family was put into concentration camps by the Germans, and gulags by the Russians. On my grandfather's side, it seems everyone died except him and his uncle. Do I go around proclaiming my victim-hood? No, because it wasn't me who suffered, I understand that things are different now, and I understand human nature well enough not to blame current Germans and Russians for what happened. My grandparents didn't hate them either.

They deny others' lived realities.

I have just as much right, as a "white cis hetero" person, to go around blaming everyone for my problems as they do. I'd only be blocked out because progressivism hasn't yet reached the education level where they'd realize there are a lot more "victims" out there than they think.

The West is the only culture to ever shed barbaric treatment of the "other" and begin to welcome all as equals. The West is the world's pioneer in social justice.

They mischaracterize the West as this extremely racist culture, where everyone seems to just hate black people. There is racism, for sure, but the West is the only place where the experiment of true multi-culturalism is embraced. We need reform, not demonization, and not constant bitching about the past. The racists have a point when they say "if you don't like it, leave" - that is very much true about this experiment, it's optional and we're all part of it. If people don't like the culture, they can freely leave to better pastures.

The reason why we see the enslavement of the Africans as worse as all the others is, because of the way we saw ourselves compared to them.

The Slavic and European held by the Muslims and Western Europeans were seen as having equal worth as human beings and were treated with some dignity. 
African Slaves were seen as subhuman beasts that had to be tamed, so all of the violence against them was seen as justified and morally good and white people saw themselves as vastly superior to them, a mindset that remains with a lot of whites up to this day.

body:
While I agree with a lot of what you say I have a problem with this statement of yours.
>The racists have a point when they say "if you don't like it, leave" - that is very much true about this experiment, it's optional and we're all part of it. If people don't like the culture, they can freely leave to better pastures.

If no culture is "good enough" where are people to go to? 
You are right, the west is not an extremely racist culture, but it is racist nonetheless and should be changed anyway, hopefully to the better. 

And yes the Nazis hated and exterminized the Slavs to clear the Land to the east to have more Wohnraum, because they thought of them as a lesser race, but neo-nazis nowadays don't seem to have picked up that part of the ideology idk why. So I'd say that that's a part of history that has unjustly been forgotten in the West, probably because the US and it's Satelite States in Western Europe where too busy thinking all Slavs where Communists.

But yes, overall I agree with you, but I think that first we should revolutionize the West, as people living in the West and then spread our revolution across the world.

The racists have a point when they say "if you don't like it, leave" - that is very much true about this experiment, it's optional and we're all part of it. If people don't like the culture, they can freely leave to better pastures.

If no culture is "good enough" where are people to go to? You are right, the west is not an extremely racist culture, but it is racist nonetheless and should be changed anyway, hopefully to the better.

And yes the Nazis hated and exterminized the Slavs to clear the Land to the east to have more Wohnraum, because they thought of them as a lesser race, but neo-nazis nowadays don't seem to have picked up that part of the ideology idk why. So I'd say that that's a part of history that has unjustly been forgotten in the West, probably because the US and it's Satelite States in Western Europe where too busy thinking all Slavs where Communists.

But yes, overall I agree with you, but I think that first we should revolutionize the West, as people living in the West and then spread our revolution across the world.

post.title: This post was deleted few hours ago

body:
Totally, we need change... But what's currently happening is the first stages of authoritarianism, which I think is more pressing right now. We are, afterall, **free speech refugees on an underground social network.**

Before we can change, we need to identify the problems our society faces. That means the things I said above need to be acknowledged and addressed fully, as well as a slew of other points that are currently being censored.

I can think of 3 very reasonable changes that would benefit everyone, including black people: ending the war on drugs (which is proven systematic racism that affects the entire working class as well), prison reform, and change of police protocol when dealing with resisting citizens.

Understand that a revolution in the direction we're heading in likely leads to a moralist authoritarian Democrat president in November. I'm in no way for Trump or a Republican, but I can smell a dictator on the horizon in this climate.

You're right that if there are no better places, then you have to fight for what you've got. It's just that the activists seem to think there are better places.
body_html:
Totally, we need change... But what's currently happening is the first stages of authoritarianism, which I think is more pressing right now. We are, afterall, free speech refugees on an underground social network.

Before we can change, we need to identify the problems our society faces. That means the things I said above need to be acknowledged and addressed fully, as well as a slew of other points that are currently being censored.

I can think of 3 very reasonable changes that would benefit everyone, including black people: ending the war on drugs (which is proven systematic racism that affects the entire working class as well), prison reform, and change of police protocol when dealing with resisting citizens.

Understand that a revolution in the direction we're heading in likely leads to a moralist authoritarian Democrat president in November. I'm in no way for Trump or a Republican, but I can smell a dictator on the horizon in this climate.

You're right that if there are no better places, then you have to fight for what you've got. It's just that the activists seem to think there are better places.

parent.body:
While I agree with a lot of what you say I have a problem with this statement of yours.
>The racists have a point when they say "if you don't like it, leave" - that is very much true about this experiment, it's optional and we're all part of it. If people don't like the culture, they can freely leave to better pastures.

If no culture is "good enough" where are people to go to? 
You are right, the west is not an extremely racist culture, but it is racist nonetheless and should be changed anyway, hopefully to the better. 

And yes the Nazis hated and exterminized the Slavs to clear the Land to the east to have more Wohnraum, because they thought of them as a lesser race, but neo-nazis nowadays don't seem to have picked up that part of the ideology idk why. So I'd say that that's a part of history that has unjustly been forgotten in the West, probably because the US and it's Satelite States in Western Europe where too busy thinking all Slavs where Communists.

But yes, overall I agree with you, but I think that first we should revolutionize the West, as people living in the West and then spread our revolution across the world.
parent.body_html:
While I agree with a lot of what you say I have a problem with this statement of yours.

The racists have a point when they say "if you don't like it, leave" - that is very much true about this experiment, it's optional and we're all part of it. If people don't like the culture, they can freely leave to better pastures.

If no culture is "good enough" where are people to go to? You are right, the west is not an extremely racist culture, but it is racist nonetheless and should be changed anyway, hopefully to the better.

And yes the Nazis hated and exterminized the Slavs to clear the Land to the east to have more Wohnraum, because they thought of them as a lesser race, but neo-nazis nowadays don't seem to have picked up that part of the ideology idk why. So I'd say that that's a part of history that has unjustly been forgotten in the West, probably because the US and it's Satelite States in Western Europe where too busy thinking all Slavs where Communists.

But yes, overall I agree with you, but I think that first we should revolutionize the West, as people living in the West and then spread our revolution across the world.

post.title: This post was deleted few hours ago

body:
I don't fully agree with what you say. 
Although yes I do agree that free speech is important and should be preserved, I don't think that harmful opinions should be allowed to be spread unrestrained. I do agree that websites, like reddit are censoring opinions that are completely valid, like skeptic critique of the violence within black lives matter movement or critiques to the Chinese gov, but I do think that blatant anti-semitic or racist comments shouldn't be allowed to be made anywhere. 

But then again we would need not to have a few corporations and heads of state deciding where that line is to be drawn, because then people wouldn't be able to criticize things that governemnts do and we'd go into the realm of Autoritarianism. 

But I firmly believe that Fascists, Bigots, Racists, Misogynists and Anti Semites shouldn't be allowed to speak and be called out whenever they do. And it should be the people, the communities job to silence them, not a few mods, but everyone should be able to report someone/flag them and after an x number of reports or flags the statement being deleted.
body_html:

But then again we would need not to have a few corporations and heads of state deciding where that line is to be drawn, because then people wouldn't be able to criticize things that governemnts do and we'd go into the realm of Autoritarianism.

But I firmly believe that Fascists, Bigots, Racists, Misogynists and Anti Semites shouldn't be allowed to speak and be called out whenever they do. And it should be the people, the communities job to silence them, not a few mods, but everyone should be able to report someone/flag them and after an x number of reports or flags the statement being deleted.

post.title: This post was deleted few hours ago

body:
Yeah I fully agree that silencing is not enough, I know I didn't make that clear enough. I just think we should stop them from saying what they do by deleting and then going to them and personally talking to them, in the cases where it's possible. Try to find the racists not to publically shame them and ruin their lives, but to show them how and why they are wrong and help them with their problems, so that feelings of pointless hatred. 
If society were perfect we wouldn't need to silence people spreading hatred, because people wouldn't buy their shit and would work together to show them the way.

>On your list of ideally censored people, where are the Misandrists, Communists, Flat Earthers, Climate Deniers, Islamophobes, Ablists, Fat Shamers, Zionists, Supremacists, Narcissists, Holocaust Deniers, Pedophiles, Ageists, Homophobes, Heterophobes, and Xenophobes?

  Misandrists, Fat Shamers, Xenophobes and Supremacistst weren't said by me, because they didn't come to mind immediately, but are very much included, Islamophobes are included in the racists.

  Zionists are form what I know, but I don't know much about them, so I could be wrong, basically the jewish version of white nationalists, so if that is the case, then it also applies to them. I just don't know   enough about them to make any claims.

  Holocaust deniers are always anti-semitic

  Pedophilia is already illegal and those people are mentally ill and should be treated and those who pretend to be a type of LGBT and call themselves MAP disgust me

  Flat earthers aren't dangerous and can talk all they want, it doesn't change anything, climate deniers are dangerous and should be silenced and educated, yes.

  I don't think heterophobes really exist, tbh I think it's just people taking a few people's words way out of proportion (one or two exceptions might be there, but it's just that)

  Being a communist is not inherently bad. There were bad communists yes and the soviet union was an authoritarian shit-hole. But communism, as an ideology isn't at all bad. And not all communists are bad people as well. It's just a shame that the biggest communist country to ever exist that influenced all the others was run by a very bad man and his legacy was kept on going by the ones who came after him. But that is a problem with Stalinism and not communism itself.

Misandrists, Fat Shamers, Xenophobes and Supremacistst weren't said by me, because they didn't come to mind immediately, but are very much included, Islamophobes are included in the racists.

Zionists are form what I know, but I don't know much about them, so I could be wrong, basically the jewish version of white nationalists, so if that is the case, then it also applies to them. I just don't know enough about them to make any claims.

Holocaust deniers are always anti-semitic

Pedophilia is already illegal and those people are mentally ill and should be treated and those who pretend to be a type of LGBT and call themselves MAP disgust me

Flat earthers aren't dangerous and can talk all they want, it doesn't change anything, climate deniers are dangerous and should be silenced and educated, yes.

I don't think heterophobes really exist, tbh I think it's just people taking a few people's words way out of proportion (one or two exceptions might be there, but it's just that)

Being a communist is not inherently bad. There were bad communists yes and the soviet union was an authoritarian shit-hole. But communism, as an ideology isn't at all bad. And not all communists are bad people as well. It's just a shame that the biggest communist country to ever exist that influenced all the others was run by a very bad man and his legacy was kept on going by the ones who came after him. But that is a problem with Stalinism and not communism itself.

post.title: This post was deleted few hours ago

body:
Maybe freedom of discourse should be tiered according to the platform. There should be moderation, but I disagree about censorship.

When I put Communism on the list, what if that actually happened? What would you think of the censorship then?

IMO, Communism needs to be reworked before it can be brought back to the table, it's a great idea on paper but has never worked and has caused endless misery. Also, Castro's Cuba wasn't Stalinist. I'm sure there are some other examples especially in South America (Venezuela right now I think) that aren't Stalinist.
body_html:

IMO, Communism needs to be reworked before it can be brought back to the table, it's a great idea on paper but has never worked and has caused endless misery. Also, Castro's Cuba wasn't Stalinist. I'm sure there are some other examples especially in South America (Venezuela right now I think) that aren't Stalinist.

post.title: This post was deleted few hours ago

body:
Yes, I also disagree with censorship, and maybe our definition of censorship and what each of us considers censorship differs. 

Well communists have been censored throughout the 20th century in the USA and it's satelite states in western Europe (in other words the nato countries)
And I don't think that that was good.

Not many countries have been turned socialist, and those that have were mostly very poor before turning socialist and most of them were satelite states of the soviet union anyway.

Venezuela wasn't socialist, it was a capitalist with a big welfare state, also known as a social democracy. And it failed not because it was socialist, but because it depended 100%  on oil.
I personally wouldn't consider Cuba that bad of a place. Yes it does have some problems with press freedom that need to be changed. It's slightly sub-par economic state can be blamed on the Embargo placed on it by the US since 1960, which has hindered Cuba from doing trade with the US and many other countries in fear of US retaliation.

Not many countries have been turned socialist, and those that have were mostly very poor before turning socialist and most of them were satelite states of the soviet union anyway.

Venezuela wasn't socialist, it was a capitalist with a big welfare state, also known as a social democracy. And it failed not because it was socialist, but because it depended 100% on oil. I personally wouldn't consider Cuba that bad of a place. Yes it does have some problems with press freedom that need to be changed. It's slightly sub-par economic state can be blamed on the Embargo placed on it by the US since 1960, which has hindered Cuba from doing trade with the US and many other countries in fear of US retaliation.
